latex:
Horses X, Y and Z are entered in a three-horse race in which ties are not possible.  If the odds against X winning are $3-to-1$ and the odds against Y winning are $2-to-3$, what are the odds against Z winning?  (By "\textit{odds against H winning are p-to-q}" we mean that probability of H winning the race is $\frac{q}{p+q}$.)\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 3-to-20\qquad\textbf{(B)}\ 5-to-6\qquad\textbf{(C)}\ 8-to-5\qquad\textbf{(D)}\ 17-to-3\qquad\textbf{(E)}\ 20-to-3 $
